attributes.comment:
I am writing to express my concern for the proposed USCIS fee hike for
application processing for the I-102, I-129, I-140, I-539, I-765, and other
forms frequently submitted to USCIS. In most cases, the proposed increases are
double the current fees and would be beyond the ability to pay for most
petitioners, many of whom are here as non-immigrants and have undertaken
substantial costs to be in the U.S. in their current status. Many of these
applications are for petitioners to apply for work authorization in their
current status or to adjust their status to a category that will give them more
employment opportunities. Making the fees prohibitively expensive for these
petitioners defeats any economic benefit that they would gain by having their
petitions approved. While we understand that fee increases are periodically
necessary for USCIS to support its administrative costs, we feel that a steep
increase in such a short amount of time is excessive. Incremental increases of
5-10% per year is more reasonable and would allow petitioners sufficient time to
prepare financially for these necessary expenses.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted Krittika Onsanit, University of Richmond
